text: "Sometimes a Memory Ain't Enough" is a song written by Stan Kesler and originally recorded by Jerry Lee Lewis for his Kesler-produced Mercury Records' album of the same name (1973). It was also released as a single (with "I Think I Need to Pray" on the flip side), reaching number 3 on the Cash Box Country Singles chart and number 6 on the Billboard country chart. == Track listing == Notes: "From Mercury's album Sometimes a Memory Ain't Enough SRM-1-677" == Charts == {|class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" !align="center"|Chart (1973) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"| U.S. Cash Box Country Singles | align="center"| 3 |- |} == References == Category:1973 songs Category:1973 singles Category:Jerry Lee Lewis songs Category:Sun Records singles Category:Country music songs
title: Sometimes a Memory Ain't Enough (song)
